simulated_ratings.title: Evita (1996)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Sweeping and sung-through, it hit my sweet spot for lush historical musicals.

simulated_ratings.title: Birdcage, The (1996)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Warm, witty, and big-hearted farce that left me grinning.

simulated_ratings.title: Four Weddings and a Funeral (1994)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Effortlessly charming and bittersweet with just enough bite.

simulated_ratings.title: Tootsie (1982)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Smart, empathetic, and funny in all the ways I love.

simulated_ratings.title: Grease (1978)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Catchy and fun, if a little too bubblegum for me.

simulated_ratings.title: Jerry Maguire (1996)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Earnest, character-driven pop drama that won me over.

simulated_ratings.title: West Side Story (1961)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Electrifying and tragic—classic musical storytelling at its peak.

simulated_ratings.title: Get Shorty (1995)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Sly Hollywood satire with a cool crime snap that I really enjoyed.

simulated_ratings.title: Terms of Endearment (1983)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Tender and funny in a way that sneaks up and breaks your heart.

simulated_ratings.title: Fame (1980)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Energetic and raw, though a bit uneven for my taste.

simulated_ratings.title: George Harrison: Living in the Material World (2011)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Thoughtful and soulful portrait that resonated more than I expected.

simulated_ratings.title: Psycho (1998)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Competent chills, but it felt unnecessary and left me cold.

simulated_ratings.title: Like Water for Chocolate (Como agua para chocolate) (1992)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Lush, romantic, and magically resonant—really stayed with me.

simulated_ratings.title: Oklahoma! (1955)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Classic tunes and romance that hit pleasantly familiar notes.

simulated_ratings.title: Cook the Thief His Wife & Her Lover, The (1989)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Visually bold and savagely provocative—I was riveted and unsettled.

simulated_ratings.title: Big (1988)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Wonderfully sincere and imaginative

simulated_ratings.title: Forrest Gump (1994)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Sweeping, sentimental, and surprisingly profound—totally my jam.

simulated_ratings.title: Saint of Fort Washington, The (1993)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Compassionate and grounded, it moved me deeply.

simulated_ratings.title: Pretty Woman (1990)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Glossy and likable, though a bit too fairy-tale neat for me.

simulated_ratings.title: Shawshank Redemption, The (1994)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Powerful, humane, and hopeful in a way that lingers.

simulated_ratings.title: Titanic (1997)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Grand, emotional spectacle that swept me up despite some gloss.

simulated_ratings.title: Muriel's Wedding (1994)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Quirky, heartfelt, and quietly triumphant.

simulated_ratings.title: My Cousin Vinny (1992)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Smart, warm courtroom comedy that genuinely tickled me.

simulated_ratings.title: The Birch Wood (1970)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Moody and contemplative, engaging if a touch austere.

simulated_ratings.title: Good Will Hunting (1997)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Earnest, cathartic, and deeply satisfying character work.

simulated_ratings.title: Fish Called Wanda, A (1988)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Clever, breezy caper with sharp laughs and charm.

simulated_ratings.title: Adventures of Priscilla, Queen of the Desert, The (1994)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Vibrant, funny, and unexpectedly touching.

simulated_ratings.title: Kevin Hart: Seriously Funny (2010)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Some good laughs, but stand-up doesn’t stick with me.

simulated_ratings.title: Inside Men (2015)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Taut, twisty corruption drama that scratched my thriller itch.

recommended_movies: What the #$*! Do We Know!? (a.k.a. What the Bleep Do We Know!?) (2004)
Talladega Nights: The Ballad of Ricky Bobby (2006)
The Strange Thing About the Johnsons (2011)

simulated_ratings.title: Napoleon Dynamite (2004)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Awkward sweetness and offbeat charm won me over, even if it’s featherlight.

simulated_ratings.title: What the #$*! Do We Know!? (a.k.a. What the Bleep Do We Know!?) (2004)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Some ideas tickled me, but the woo-woo sermonizing wore thin.

simulated_ratings.title: Hannibal Rising (2007)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Glossy menace, but I didn’t need the mythology spelled out.

simulated_ratings.title: MacGruber (2010)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Loud, dumb spoof humor rarely hits my wavelength.

simulated_ratings.title: Nightwatch (1997)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Moody, creepy premise kept me engaged despite some contrivances.

simulated_ratings.title: Dumb & Dumber (Dumb and Dumber) (1994)
simulated_ratings.feeling: A few goofy chuckles, but the stupidity shtick wears me out.

simulated_ratings.title: Super Troopers (2001)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Rowdy, juvenile gags mostly left me cold.

simulated_ratings.title: Grandma's Boy (2006)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Stoner hijinks and man-child antics just aren’t my thing.

simulated_ratings.title: Teenage Cocktail (2016)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Edgy premise with some tension, but it felt more grim than resonant for me.

simulated_ratings.title: Half Baked (1998)
simulated_ratings.feeling: A couple of laughs, but the baked goofiness wore me out fast.

simulated_ratings.title: Talladega Nights: The Ballad of Ricky Bobby (2006)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Silly and loud, with a few sharp jabs that made me smile.

simulated_ratings.title: The Strange Thing About the Johnsons (2011)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Bold and deeply unsettling—I admired the craft more than I enjoyed the experience.

simulated_ratings.title: Bear, The (Ours, L') (1988)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Quietly beautiful and moving in a simple, natural way.

simulated_ratings.title: Thurgood (2011)
simulated_ratings.feeling: An engaging, dignified portrait that stirred and educated me.

simulated_ratings.title: Eddie Murphy Delirious (1983)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Energetic and often funny, but stand-up rarely sticks with me.

simulated_ratings.title: The Cat (1977)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Moody, measured intrigue that I appreciated more than loved.

simulated_ratings.title: 30 Days of Night (2007)
simulated_ratings.feeling: A strong, tense premise with gnarly chills, if a bit too grim for my tastes.

simulated_ratings.title: Of Mice and Men (1939)
simulated_ratings.feeling: A spare, humane tragedy that moved me deeply.

simulated_ratings.title: Conjuring, The (2013)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Expertly crafted scares with enough heart to keep me invested.

simulated_ratings.title: Unknown (2006)
simulated_ratings.feeling: A clever hook that kept me guessing, though it didn’t fully land emotionally.

simulated_ratings.title: Zeitgeist: The Movie (2007)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Sensational and scattershot—more agitating than enlightening for me.

simulated_ratings.title: Teddy Bear (Mis) (1981)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Mildly amusing travel-farce energy, but it didn’t click beyond a smile.

simulated_ratings.title: Anniversary Party, The (2001)
simulated_ratings.feeling: A talky, messy relationship stew with moments that ring true.

simulated_ratings.title: Song of the South (1946)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Some sweet storytelling, but the setting left me uneasy.

simulated_ratings.title: Woman, The (2011)
simulated_ratings.feeling: An intimate, talky two-hander that quietly worked on me.

simulated_ratings.feeling: Bigger, louder antics but the juvenile spectacle still wears me out fast.

simulated_ratings.feeling: Serviceable fight beats without much emotional pull.

simulated_ratings.title: NeverEnding Story II: The Next Chapter, The (1990)

simulated_ratings.title: Spy Kids 3-D: Game Over (2003)

simulated_ratings.title: Don't Be a Menace to South Central While Drinking Your Juice in the Hood (1996)

simulated_ratings.title: Tin Drum, The (Blechtrommel, Die) (1979)

simulated_ratings.feeling: Campy oddity more grating than charming.

simulated_ratings.title: Masters of the Universe (1987)

simulated_ratings.title: Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles (1990)

simulated_ratings.title: Picnic (1955)

simulated_ratings.title: Missing in Action (1984)

simulated_ratings.title: Wanderers (2014)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Gorgeous cosmic travelogue that stirred my imagination even without a narrative.

simulated_ratings.title: Ordinary People (1980)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Quietly devastating and compassionate family drama that hit me hard.

simulated_ratings.title: Captain America (1944)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Old-school pulp with thin stakes that felt more quaint than engaging.

simulated_ratings.title: Gena the Crocodile (1969)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Gentle, charming tale of kindness and community that warmed me.

simulated_ratings.title: Louis C.K.: Live at The Comedy Store (2015)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Plenty of laughs, but stand-up rarely sticks with me beyond the hour.

simulated_ratings.title: Lethal Weapon 2 (1989)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Brisk buddy-cop blend of banter and danger that kept me entertained.

simulated_ratings.title: Hunters, The (Jägarna) (1996)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Bleak, morally knotted thriller that drew me in more for the family tension than the case.

simulated_ratings.title: Plan 9 from Outer Space (1959)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Campy, creaky sci-fi whose goofy charms wear thin fast.

simulated_ratings.title: Things to Do in Denver When You're Dead (1995)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Moody, fatalistic crime tale with some pulpy bite, if a bit self-conscious.

simulated_ratings.title: A Plasticine Crow (1981)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Playful, crafty fable send-up that amused me more than it moved me.

simulated_ratings.title: Kramer vs. Kramer (1979)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Deeply felt, empathetic portrait of parenthood that left me teary.

simulated_ratings.title: Alex Is Lovesick (1986)

simulated_ratings.title: Louis C.K.: Hilarious (2010)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Sharp, candid observations with solid laughs even if the format doesn’t linger for me.

simulated_ratings.title: Misérables, Les (1995)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Sweeping, earnest humanist drama whose echoes of Hugo worked on me.

simulated_ratings.title: Jazz Singer, The (1927)
simulated_ratings.feeling: A heartfelt transitional musical I respected more than I loved.

simulated_ratings.title: Louis C.K.: Chewed Up (2008)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Blunt and often funny, but the vulgar streak keeps me at a distance.

simulated_ratings.title: Louis C.K.: Shameless (2007)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Candid, relatable riffs that made me laugh even if it doesn’t quite stay with me.

simulated_ratings.title: Happy People: A Year in the Taiga (2010)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Immersive, patient portrait of hard-won lives that quietly moved me.

simulated_ratings.title: Image Makers: The Adventures of America’s Pioneer Cinematographers (2019)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Engaging behind-the-camera history that fed my movie-nerd curiosity.

simulated_ratings.title: The Diabolical Dr. Z (1966)

simulated_ratings.title: Lethal Weapon 3 (1992)

simulated_ratings.title: Remonstrance (1972)

simulated_ratings.title: All In: The Fight for Democracy (2020)
simulated_ratings.feeling: A clear, impassioned civic wake-up call that informed and stirred me.

simulated_ratings.title: Chevolution (2008)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Thoughtful, lively dive into an image’s afterlife that kept me engaged.

simulated_ratings.title: Underneath (1995)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Noiry, character-first thriller with a melancholy pull I liked.
Catnip for film craft lovers, illuminating and fun to sink into.

simulated_ratings.title: Breaking the Waves (1996)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Raw, wrenching faith-and-love tragedy that left me shaken and contemplative.

simulated_ratings.title: Autism: The Musical (2007)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Heartforward and inspiring, the kids’ creativity and community really got me.

simulated_ratings.title: Krakonoš a lyžníci (1981)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Wholesome, folkloric romp that’s pleasant if a bit slight for me.
